titlestmt.titleproper: [Waco] L.L. Sams Stained Glass Studio records, Inclusive: 1952-1992, Bulk: 1970-1985

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Records Summary
did.unittitle: [Waco] L.L. Sams Stained Glass Studio records

physdesc.extent: 6 document boxes, 4 OVZ boxes, and 9 OVZ folders

did.abstract: The L. L. Sams Stained Glass Studio records include project files, renderings, and slides that document the creation and installation of stained glass windows in Texas institutions such as churches, schools, and military installations. Correspondence, sketches, photographs, product samples, oversize drawings, and colored renderings are included.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The L.L. Sams and Sons Company was founded in 1898 by L.L Sams. He was the first Texas sales representative for the E.H. Stafford company located in Michigan. Sams and Sons Company was strictly a sales agency until 1946 when they began manufacturing their own products.

As clientele, needs, and trends evolved, the L.L. Sams and Sons Company began to branch out as well. They began by creating a separate manufacturing division, followed by church renovations, stained glass production, and several other endeavors through the years. The L.L. Sams Stained Glass Studio began in 1965 with three artists: Robert Mansfield, Ron Estep, and Annabelle Estep. Ron Estep created one of the studio's largest pieces, a 1,000 square foot panel depicting the life of Jesus Christ through symbols. The window was commissioned by Grove Avenue Baptist Church in Richmond, Virginia, and took over one year to complete.

The studio created high quality pieces utilizing the dalle de verre technique, a mixture of sand and epoxy to fit the glass together instead of the traditional lead. While the studio began only servicing religious institutions, as requests slowed, they took on projects from schools, restaurants, military installations, and other entities. When the larger L. L. Sams and Sons Company merged with the Royal Seating Company the Stained Glass Studio dissolved and sold their remaining glass inventory to Bryant Stanton of Stanton Glass studio, located in Waco, Texas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: [Waco] L.L. Sams Stained Glass Studio records contain three series: I. Project Files, II. Renderings, and III. Slides. Project Files highlight the preparation and business aspects of creating a stained glass piece. Correspondence and financial agreements comprise a good portion of this series, but drawings and sketches portray the preparation needed before creation. Oversize drafts and architectural prints illustrate installations and provide a guide for size and colors utilized in final production.

The Renderings series contains colored scale drawings of pieces installed in churches and military installations. Some include notes for improvements suggesting that clients were included in the planning stages. These renderings often match up with project files, but not all will have corresponding data.
Slides are representative of the creation and installation process of stained glass window making. The slides depict the maker process from design to installation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection was previously arranged into boxes based on material type and size. Project files were arranged alphabetically by site location while renderings and slides had no formal arrangement. The collection is now arranged into three series: I. Project Files, II. Renderings, and III. Slides.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Waco] L. L. Sams Stained Glass Studio records, Accession #3223, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Sylvia Hernandez. Released on 2020-03-27.

relatedmaterial.head: Items in related collections

relatedmaterial.head: Related references

bibref.extref: Bakke, Bruce B. “Church Renovation Calls for Special Skills in Craftsmanship -- and in Selling: ‘You Don’t Talk to an Evangelist the Same Way You Talk to a Monsignor’.” United Press International. 1984 August 26. Accessed 2020 February 3.
Fredensprung, Amanda. “Stained-Glass Wizard: Meet the Man Behind the Creations of Stanton Glass Studio.” Waco Tribune-Herald (Waco, TX), 2013 February 28. Accessed 2020 February 3.

relatedmaterial.bibref: “Good Pews for Modern Man.” Texas Monthly. 1979 November.

bibref.extref: Smith, Daniel. “Living in the Past.” Focus Magazine. 2015 November 29. Accessed 2020 February 3.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Project Files series is dated 1952-1992, and includes preliminary sketches, detail and process drawings, correspondence, contracts, purchase orders (with additional notes), and estimates. Also included are installation photographs in the form of slides, polaroid and 35mm prints. Occasional fabric samples are present as well. The series retained original order, alphabetical by site location, and is in good condition.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Archivist''s Notes: Some items have been separated from the main body of this series due to their size. Please contact an archivist to view the additional material listed on the separation sheet.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Renderings series is mostly undated; however, pieces can be cross-referenced with Project Files to obtain further information accordingly. Scale drawings of glass projects are present, some with notes documenting corrections and improvements to adjust before preparation. Items are listed alphabetically by site location, but physically they are arranged by size. This series is in good condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Slides series includes pieces from 1976-1983. They show the manufacturing and installation processes of the windows as well as finished products. The series is arranged chronologically and is in excellent condition.
